title: The Different Stages of Sannyasa | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: There are four stages of advancement in sannyas.
Kutichaka, Bahudaka, Parivrajaka, Paramahamsa.
Kutichaka is the beginning stage of sannyas.
Prabhupada says generally they construct a cottage
outside the village or outside the usual place of residence.
And they live there and from home they receive some simple food
so that they are not bothered about preparing food,
gathering the ingredients, etc.
They can fully devote themselves for practicing tapasya,
for studying the scriptures, for practicing austerity, etc.
Bahudaka means he will collect a little, little, little from many homes
by going and...
begging, bhiksha.
And this is also called Madhukari.
Madhukari means the business of a bumble bee.
A bee collects the nectar from flowers,
a very little from each flower.
But it gathers so much that it is able to make a whole honeycomb.
When one becomes even further advanced,
then one starts travelling.
Then one starts learning and preaching.
Parivrajaka does not stay in one place.
According to the rules of sannyas, ashram, strict rules,
one should not stay in a place more than three days.
As the Paramahamsa is about all varnas and all ashramas,
he's a pure devotee.
Devotees who are fully devoted to serving Krishna
without caring for any personal comforts,
they are actually,
paramahamsas so these strict rules of sannyas are not possible to be followed
in Kali Yuga therefore in Kali Yuga it is said sannyas is forbidden but even the
followers of Chaitanya they accept the essence of this principle of sannyas
which is traveling and preaching and some minimum rules of sannyas are
accepted but not all the rules so that the preaching can be done without much
difficulty and that's our main business
